result.execSummary:
The defendant Ismael Hipolito was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ismael Hipolito

defendant.name: Hipolito, Ismael
defendant.address: 178 West Van Norman Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53207

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.

Defendant Ismael Hipolito in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Ismael Hipolito.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and any treatment.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete 80 hours of community service. 
- Full-time work (minimum of 40 hours per week).
- Provide DNA sample. 

Court set restitution at zero.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Ismael Hipolito in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-18-2022
received and filed.

Defendant Ismael Hipolito in court with Attorney Vincent Guimont.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-24-2022
22RM014962  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/21/2022
Received and Filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Walmart,  South Milwaukee or any of its employees
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
MCSO did not provide executed warrant at time of scheduling.  Defendant at Dodge Correctional Institution.

Defendant Ismael Hipolito in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ismael Hipolito in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ismael Hipolito appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Ismael Hipolito not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/22 @ 2:30p
